column5: Yesterday afternoon I went out for a walk in the woods.   I also took my fishing rod with me and a handful of very small spinners. Swarming clouds of blackflies, but I also got this little brookie:   I'm so happy now!
Love the colors on those little stream brookies. Thx for sharin.
Wow...that's an unusual color for a Brookie...did you keep it??
Some nice colours in that Brookie!
No, I didn't keep it. Too beautiful to kill. I have another picture from a year ago, different stream, though:   It's an even smaller fish, but the colors on it are gorgeous...
Simply stunning  In all the years of angling, I have yet to catch one of those.  Looks like catching one will be added to my life's To-do list before I die.  Great pics.
Those are a couple of nicely coloured brookies. Nice time of year for stroll through headwaters, despite bugs.  ehg

I have a little spot like that the colours are absolutely beautiful. We call them halloween brookies because of the orange colours here is a pick of one    And Im not even going to be secretive and black out the background this is what they come out of    Those colours are so beautiful on your fish. Easy to see how one can become a dedicated brook trout angler.

That's funny 'musky or specks' i've caught many specks from places like that. Around farmland at headwaters of Saugeen or Grand R.  About 20 yrs. ago i caught brookies like that from culvert on side of 115 on way to Peterborough. Turns out the little flow emptied into Cavan R. which emptied into Otonabee R. then Rice Lake etc.. Weird! Brookies are in most headwaters of Ontario rivers if you look around a bit.  ehg
amazing colors. That has to be the most beautiful fish i have seen thus far, makes a great wallpaper!  Thanks for sharing!

OH on M or S ,can just see the 20 to 30 cars parked beside that caulvert now , should have blacked out the background lol , love the colors of trout , browns to look great from a small stream , great pics
Simply amazing photographs!  Thanks for the report....
Gorgeous fish Danubian. You really gotta love those small stream Brookies.  Halloween fish. I like that Musky or Specks.  In keeping with that theme, I'll call this guy "the Great Pumpkin".
